article.title: Sentiment Classification using Images and Label Embeddings

multiple_choice_question.text: What evaluation metric was primarily used to compare the performance of different models in this study?
What type of neural network architecture was used for the text model in the combined image and text approach?
What technique was employed to address the challenge of noisy data in the machine-labeled dataset?
choices: Labeling using adjective-noun pairs and associated sentiment scores.
Applying a Gaussian filter to smooth out noisy data points.
Using a majority voting mechanism based on multiple labeling tools.
Discarding data points with low confidence scores from the labeling tool.

multiple_choice_question.text: What was the main motivation behind projecting the model output to an embedding space?
choices: To reduce computational complexity and training time.
To visualize the model\'s decision boundaries in a lower-dimensional space.
To assess how predicted sentiments of different examples relate to each other and potentially generalize to unknown sentiments.
To improve the model\'s ability to handle missing or incomplete data.
